page.title: 20GARDENS IN TREGONY
page.content: PROPERTIES OF TREGONY LINING FORE STREET HAVE LONG,GARDENS AT RIGHT ANGLES TO THE HOUSE AND SOME A PADDOCK. IN MILL LANE AND TREGONY HILL GARDENS ARE SMALLER. UNTIL THE 1940S THEIR PLOTS WERE USED VIEW TO SELF-RELIANCE. CROPS OF POTATOES,CABBAGE,ONIONS AND RUNNER BEANS WERE PRODUCED. MOST GARDENS HAD A FEW APPLE TREES,CHICKENS AND USUALLY TWO PIGS WERE KEPT, ONE FOR SALE, ONE FOR THE FAMILY. SOME KEPT A COW. SINCE 1950, A CHANGE IN DOMESTIC LIFE STYLE HAS REDUCED THE IDEA OF SELF SUF- FICIENTCY.NO GARDENS ARE NOW FULLY CULTIVATED AND LAWNS ARE ANNUALLY CUT, GRASS HAS REDUCED VEGETABLE PRODUCTION TO LIMITED SIGNIFICANCE.SOME PLOTS ARE NEGLECTED OR CONVERTED TO OTHER USES.18 GARDENS HAVE BEEN SUB-DIVIDED AND SOLD AS BUILDING PLOTS.(1970)
